00026 /*
00027  * Copyright (c) 2007, 2010, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.
00028  * Use is subject to license terms.

00032 /*
00033  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00034  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00035  *
00036  * lustre/utils/llverfs.c
00037  *
00038  * Filesystem Verification Tool.
00039  * This program tests the correct operation of large filesystems and
00040  * the underlying block storage device(s).
00041  * This tool have two working modes
00042  * 1. full mode
00043  * 2. partial mode
00044  *
00045  * In full mode, the program creates a subdirectory in the test
00046  * filesystem, writes n(files_in_dir, default=32) large(4GB) files to
00047  * the directory with the test pattern at the start of each 4kb block.
00048  * The test pattern contains timestamp, relative file offset and per
00049  * file unique identifier(inode number).  This continues until the
00050  * whole filesystem is full and then the tool verifies that the data
00051  * in all of the test files is correct.
00052  *
00053  * In partial mode, the tool creates test directories with the
00054  * EXT3_TOPDIR_FL flag set (if supported) to spread the directory data
00055  * around the block device instead of localizing it in a single place.
00056  * The number of directories equals to the number of block groups in the
00057  * filesystem (e.g. 65536 directories for 8TB ext3/ext4 filesystem) and
00058  * then writes a single 1MB file in each directory. The tool then verifies
00059  * that the data in each file is correct.
00060  */
00061

00101 #define ONE_MB (1024 * 1024)
00102 #define ONE_GB ((unsigned long long)(1024 * 1024 * 1024))
00103 #define BLOCKSIZE 4096
00104 
00105 /* Structure for writing test pattern */
00106 struct block_data {
00107         unsigned long long bd_offset;
00108         unsigned long long bd_time;
00109         unsigned long long bd_inode;
00110 };
00111 static char *progname;              /* name by which this program was run. */
00112 static unsigned verbose = 1;        /* prints offset in kB, operation rate */
00113 static int readoption;              /* run test in read-only (verify) mode */
00114 static int writeoption;             /* run test in write_only mode */
00115 char *testdir;                      /* name of device to be tested. */
00116 static unsigned full = 1;           /* flag to full check */
00117 static int error_count;             /* number of IO errors hit during run */
00118 char filecount[PATH_MAX];           /* file with total number of files written*/
00119 static unsigned long num_files;     /* Total number of files for read/write */
00120 static loff_t file_size = 4*ONE_GB; /* Size of each file */
00121 static unsigned files_in_dir = 32;  /* number of files in each directioy */
00122 static unsigned num_dirs = 30000;   /* total number of directories */
00123 const int dirmode = S_IRWXU | S_IRGRP | S_IXGRP | S_IROTH | S_IXOTH;
00124 static int isatty_flag;
00125 static int perms =  S_IRWXU | S_IRGRP | S_IROTH;

00128 {
00129         { "chunksize", required_argument, 0, 'c' },
00130         { "help", no_argument, 0, 'h' },
00131         { "offset", required_argument, 0, 'o' },

00139         { "verbose", no_argument, 0, 'v' },

00144 /*
00145  * Usages: displays help information, whenever user supply --help option in
00146  * command or enters incorrect command line.
00147  */
00148 void usage(int status)
00149 {
00150         if (status != 0) {
00151                 printf("\nUsage: %s [OPTION]... <filesystem path> ...\n",
00152                        progname);
00153                 printf("Filesystem verification tool.\n"
00154                        "\t-t {seconds}, --timestamp,  set test time"
00155                        "(default=current time())\n"
00156                        "\t-o {offset}, --offset, directory starting offset"
00157                        " from which tests should start\n"
00158                        "\t-r, --read, run in verify mode\n"
00159                        "\t-w, --write, run in test-pattern mode, default=rw\n"
00160                        "\t-v, --verbose\n"
00161                        "\t-p, --partial, for partial check (1MB files)\n"
00162                        "\t-l, --long, --full check (4GB file with 4k blocks)\n"
00163                        "\t-c, --chunksize, IO chunk size in MB (default=1)\n"
00164                        "\t-s, --filesize, file size in MB (default=4096)\n"
00165                        "\t-h, --help, display this help and exit\n");
00166         }
00167         exit(status);
00168 }

00170 /*
00171  * open_file: Opens file in specified mode and returns fd.
00172  */
00173 static int open_file(const char *file, int flag)
00174 {
00175         int fd = open(file, flag, perms);
00176         if (fd < 0) {
00177                 fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: Open '%s' failed:%s\n",
00178                         progname, file, strerror(errno));
00179         }
00180         return (fd);
00181 }
00182 
00183 /*
00184  * Verify_chunk: Verifies test pattern in each 4kB (BLOCKSIZE) is correct.
00185  * Returns 0 if test offset and timestamp is correct otherwise 1.
00186  */
00187 int verify_chunk(char *chunk_buf, const size_t chunksize,
00188                  unsigned long long chunk_off, const unsigned long long time_st,
00189                  const unsigned long long inode_st, const char *file)
00190 {
00191         struct block_data *bd;
00192         char *chunk_end;
00193 
00194         for (chunk_end = chunk_buf + chunksize - sizeof(*bd);
00195              (char *)chunk_buf < chunk_end;
00196              chunk_buf += BLOCKSIZE, chunk_off += BLOCKSIZE) {
00197                 bd = (struct block_data *)chunk_buf;
00198                 if ((bd->bd_offset == chunk_off) && (bd->bd_time == time_st) &&
00199                     (bd->bd_inode == inode_st))
00200                         continue;
00201                 fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: verify %s failed offset/timestamp/inode "
00202                         "%llu/%llu/%llu: found %llu/%llu/%llu instead\n",
00203                         progname, file, chunk_off, time_st, inode_st,
00204                         bd->bd_offset, bd->bd_time, bd->bd_inode);
00205                 return 1;
00206         }
00207         return 0;
00208 }
00209 
00210 /*
00211  * fill_chunk: Fills the chunk with current or user specified timestamp
00212  * and offset. The test pattern is filled at the beginning of
00213  * each 4kB(BLOCKSIZE) blocks in chunk_buf.
00214  */
00215 void fill_chunk(char *chunk_buf, size_t chunksize, loff_t chunk_off,
00216                 const time_t time_st, const ino_t inode_st)
00217 {
00218         struct block_data *bd;
00219         char *chunk_end;
00220 
00221         for (chunk_end = chunk_buf + chunksize - sizeof(*bd);
00222              (char *)chunk_buf < chunk_end;
00223              chunk_buf += BLOCKSIZE, chunk_off += BLOCKSIZE) {
00224                 bd = (struct block_data *)chunk_buf;
00225                 bd->bd_offset = chunk_off;
00226                 bd->bd_time = time_st;
00227                 bd->bd_inode = inode_st;
00228         }
00229 }
00230 
00231 /*
00232  * Write a chunk to disk, handling errors, interrupted writes, etc.
00233  *
00234  * If there is an IO error hit during the write, it is possible that
00235  * this will just show up as a short write, and a subsequent write
00236  * will return the actual error.  We want to continue in the face of
00237  * minor media errors so that we can validate the whole device if
00238  * possible, but if there are many errors we don't want to loop forever.
00239  *
00240  * The error count will be returned upon exit to ensure that the
00241  * media errors are detected even if nobody is looking at the output.
00242  *
00243  * Returns 0 on success, or -ve errno on failure.
00244  */
00245 int write_retry(int fd, const char *chunk_buf, size_t nrequested,
00246                 unsigned long long offset, const char *file)
00247 {
00248         long nwritten;
00249 
00250 retry:
00251         nwritten = write(fd, chunk_buf, nrequested);
00252         if (nwritten < 0) {
00253                 if (errno != ENOSPC) {
00254                         fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: write %s@%llu+%zi failed: %s\n",
00255                                 progname, file, offset, nrequested,
00256                                 strerror(errno));
00257                         if (error_count++ < 100)
00258                                 return 0;
00259                 }
00260                 return -errno;
00261         }
00262         if (nwritten < nrequested) {
00263                 fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: write %s@%llu+%zi short: %ld written\n",
00264                         progname, file, offset, nrequested, nwritten);
00265                 offset += nwritten;
00266                 chunk_buf += nwritten;
00267                 nrequested -= nwritten;
00268                 goto retry;
00269         }
00270 
00271         return 0;
00272 }
00273 
00274 /*
00275  * write_chunks: write the chunk_buf on the device. The number of write
00276  * operations are based on the parameters write_end, offset, and chunksize.
00277  *
00278  * Returns 0 on success, or -ve error number on failure.
00279  */
00280 int write_chunks(int fd, unsigned long long offset,unsigned long long write_end,
00281                  char *chunk_buf, size_t chunksize, const time_t time_st,
00282                  const ino_t inode_st, const char *file)
00283 {
00284         unsigned long long stride;
00285 
00286         stride = full ? chunksize : (ONE_GB - chunksize);
00287         for (offset = offset & ~(chunksize - 1); offset < write_end;
00288              offset += stride) {
00289                 int ret;
00290 
00291                 if (lseek64(fd, offset, SEEK_SET) == -1) {
00292                         fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: lseek64(%s+%llu) failed: %s\n",
00293                                 progname, file, offset, strerror(errno));
00294                         return -errno;
00295                 }
00296                 if (offset + chunksize > write_end)
00297                         chunksize = write_end - offset;
00298                 if (!full && offset > chunksize) {
00299                         fill_chunk(chunk_buf, chunksize, offset, time_st,
00300                                    inode_st);
00301                         ret = write_retry(fd, chunk_buf, chunksize,offset,file);
00302                         if (ret < 0)
00303                                 return ret;
00304                         offset += chunksize;
00305                         if (offset + chunksize > write_end)
00306                                 chunksize = write_end - offset;
00307                 }
00308                 fill_chunk(chunk_buf, chunksize, offset, time_st, inode_st);
00309                 ret = write_retry(fd, chunk_buf, chunksize, offset, file);
00310                 if (ret < 0)
00311                         return ret;
00312         }
00313         return 0;
00314 }
00315 
00316 /*
00317  * read_chunk: reads the chunk_buf from the device. The number of read
00318  * operations are based on the parameters read_end, offset, and chunksize.
00319  */
00320 int read_chunks(int fd, unsigned long long offset, unsigned long long read_end,
00321                 char *chunk_buf, size_t chunksize, const time_t time_st,
00322                 const ino_t inode_st, const char *file)
00323 {
00324         unsigned long long stride;
00325 
00326         stride = full ? chunksize : (ONE_GB - chunksize);
00327         for (offset = offset & ~(chunksize - 1); offset < read_end;
00328              offset += stride) {
00329                 ssize_t nread;
00330 
00331                 if (lseek64(fd, offset, SEEK_SET) == -1) {
00332                         fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: lseek64(%s+%llu) failed: %s\n",
00333                                 progname, file, offset, strerror(errno));
00334                         return 1;
00335                 }
00336                 if (offset + chunksize > read_end)
00337                         chunksize = read_end - offset;
00338 
00339                 if (!full && offset > chunksize) {
00340                         nread = read(fd, chunk_buf, chunksize);
00341                         if (nread < 0) {
00342                                 fprintf(stderr,"\n%s: read %s@%llu+%zi failed: "
00343                                         "%s\n", progname, file, offset,
00344                                         chunksize, strerror(errno));
00345                                 error_count++;
00346                                 return 1;
00347                         }
00348                         if (nread < chunksize) {
00349                                 fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: read %s@%llu+%zi short: "
00350                                         "%zi read\n", progname, file, offset,
00351                                         chunksize, nread);
00352                                 error_count++;
00353                         }
00354                         if (verify_chunk(chunk_buf, nread, offset, time_st,
00355                                          inode_st, file) != 0) {
00356                                 return 1;
00357                         }
00358                         offset += chunksize;
00359 
00360                         /* Need to reset position after read error */
00361                         if (nread < chunksize &&
00362                             lseek64(fd, offset, SEEK_SET) == -1) {
00363                                 fprintf(stderr,
00364                                         "\n%s: lseek64(%s@%llu) failed: %s\n",
00365                                         progname, file, offset,strerror(errno));
00366                                 return 1;
00367                         }
00368                         if (offset + chunksize >= read_end)
00369                                 chunksize = read_end - offset;
00370                 }
00371                 nread = read(fd, chunk_buf, chunksize);
00372                 if (nread < 0) {
00373                         fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: read %s@%llu+%zi failed: %s\n",
00374                                 progname, file, offset, chunksize,
00375                                 strerror(errno));
00376                         error_count++;
00377                         return 1;
00378                 }
00379                 if (nread < chunksize) {
00380                         fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: read %s@%llu+%zi short: "
00381                                 "%zi read\n", progname, file, offset,
00382                                 chunksize, nread);
00383                         error_count++;
00384                 }
00385 
00386                 if (verify_chunk(chunk_buf, nread, offset, time_st,
00387                                  inode_st, file) != 0) {
00388                         return 1;
00389                 }
00390         }
00391         return 0;
00392 }

00394 /*
00395  * new_file: prepares new filename using file counter and current dir.

00397 char *new_file(char *tempfile, char *cur_dir, int file_num)
00398 {
00399         sprintf(tempfile, "%s/file%03d", cur_dir, file_num);
00400         return tempfile;
00401 }
00402 
00403 /*
00404  * new_dir: prepares new dir name using dir counters.
00405  */
00406 char *new_dir(char *tempdir, int dir_num)
00407 {
00408         sprintf(tempdir, "%s/dir%05d", testdir, dir_num);
00409         return tempdir;
00410 }
00411 
00412 /*
00413  * calc_total_bytes: calculates total bytes that need to be
00414  * written into or read from the filesystem.
00415  */
00416 static unsigned long long calc_total_bytes(const char *op)
00417 {
00418         unsigned long long total_bytes = 0;
00419         struct statfs64 statbuf;
00420 
00421         if (full) {
00422                 if (statfs64(testdir, &statbuf) == 0) {
00423                         if (strcmp(op, "write") == 0)
00424                                 total_bytes = (unsigned long long)
00425                                         (statbuf.f_bavail * statbuf.f_bsize);
00426                         else if (strcmp(op, "read") == 0)
00427                                 total_bytes = (unsigned long long)
00428                                         (statbuf.f_blocks * statbuf.f_bsize);
00429                         else {
00430                                 fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: invalid operation: %s\n",
00431                                         progname, op);
00432                                 return -1;
00433                         }
00434                 } else {
00435                         fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: unable to stat %s: %s\n",
00436                                 progname, testdir, strerror(errno));
00437                         return -errno;
00438                 }
00439         } else {
00440                 total_bytes = num_dirs * files_in_dir * file_size;
00441         }
00442 
00443         return total_bytes;
00444 }
00445 
00446 /*
00447  * show_rate: displays the current read/write file name and performance,
00448  * along with an estimate of how long the whole read/write operation
00449  * will continue.
00450  */
00451 void show_rate(char *op, char *filename, const struct timeval *start_time,
00452                const unsigned long long total_bytes,
00453                const unsigned long long curr_bytes)
00454 {
00455         static struct timeval last_time;
00456         static unsigned long long last_bytes;
00457         static char last_op;
00458         struct timeval curr_time;
00459         double curr_delta, overall_delta, curr_rate, overall_rate;
00460         double total_time, remain_time;
00461         int remain_hours, remain_minutes, remain_seconds;
00462 
00463         if (last_time.tv_sec == 0)
00464                 last_time = *start_time;
00465 
00466         if (last_op != op[0]) {
00467                 last_bytes = 0;
00468                 last_time = *start_time;
00469                 last_op = op[0];
00470         }
00471 
00472         gettimeofday(&curr_time, NULL);
00473 
00474         curr_delta = (curr_time.tv_sec - last_time.tv_sec) +
00475                 (double)(curr_time.tv_usec - last_time.tv_usec) / 1000000;
00476 
00477         overall_delta = (curr_time.tv_sec - start_time->tv_sec) +
00478                 (double)(curr_time.tv_usec - start_time->tv_usec) / 1000000;
00479 
00480         curr_rate = (curr_bytes - last_bytes) / curr_delta;
00481         overall_rate = curr_bytes / overall_delta;
00482 
00483         if (curr_rate == 0) {
00484                 last_time = curr_time;
00485                 return;
00486         }
00487         total_time = total_bytes / curr_rate;
00488         remain_time = total_time - overall_delta;
00489 
00490         remain_hours = remain_time / 3600;
00491         remain_minutes = (remain_time - remain_hours * 3600) / 60;
00492         remain_seconds = (remain_time - remain_hours * 3600 -
00493                 remain_minutes * 60);
00494 
00495         if (curr_delta > 4 || verbose > 2) {
00496                 if (isatty_flag)
00497                         printf("\r");
00498 
00499                 printf("%s filename: %s, current %5g MB/s, overall %5g MB/s, "
00500                        "est %u:%u:%u left", op, filename,
00501                        curr_rate / ONE_MB, overall_rate / ONE_MB,
00502                        remain_hours, remain_minutes, remain_seconds);
00503 
00504                 if (isatty_flag)
00505                         fflush(stdout);
00506                 else
00507                         printf("\n");
00508         }
00509 
00510         last_time = curr_time;
00511         last_bytes = curr_bytes;
00512 }
00513 
00514 /*
00515  * dir_write: This function writes directories and files on device.
00516  * it works for both full and partial modes.
00517  */
00518 static int dir_write(char *chunk_buf, size_t chunksize,
00519                      time_t time_st, unsigned long dir_num)
00520 {
00521         char tempfile[PATH_MAX];
00522         char tempdir[PATH_MAX];
00523         FILE *countfile;
00524         struct stat64 file;
00525         int file_num = 999999999;
00526         ino_t inode_st = 0;
00527         struct timeval start_time;
00528         unsigned long long total_bytes;
00529         unsigned long long curr_bytes = 0;
00530         int rc = 0;
00531 
00532 #ifdef HAVE_EXT2FS_EXT2FS_H
00533         if (!full && fsetflags(testdir, EXT2_TOPDIR_FL))
00534                 fprintf(stderr,
00535                         "\n%s: can't set TOPDIR_FL on %s: %s (ignoring)",
00536                         progname, testdir, strerror(errno));
00537 #endif
00538         countfile = fopen(filecount, "w");
00539         if (countfile == NULL) {
00540                 fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: creating %s failed :%s\n",
00541                         progname, filecount, strerror(errno));
00542                 return 5;
00543         }
00544         /* reserve space for the countfile */
00545         if (fprintf(countfile, "%lu", num_files) < 1 ||
00546             fflush(countfile) != 0) {
00547                 fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: writing %s failed :%s\n",
00548                         progname, filecount, strerror(errno));
00549                 rc = 6;
00550                 goto out;
00551         }
00552 
00553         /* calculate total bytes that need to be written */
00554         total_bytes = calc_total_bytes("write");
00555         if (total_bytes <= 0) {
00556                 fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: unable to calculate total bytes\n",
00557                         progname);
00558                 rc = 7;
00559                 goto out;
00560         }
00561 
00562         if (!full && (dir_num != 0))
00563                 total_bytes -= dir_num * files_in_dir * file_size;
00564 
00565         gettimeofday(&start_time, NULL);
00566         for (; dir_num < num_dirs; num_files++, file_num++) {
00567                 int fd, ret;
00568 
00569                 if (file_num >= files_in_dir) {
00570                         if (dir_num == num_dirs - 1)
00571                                 break;
00572 
00573                         file_num = 0;
00574                         if (mkdir(new_dir(tempdir, dir_num), dirmode) < 0) {
00575                                 if (errno == ENOSPC)
00576                                         break;
00577                                 if (errno != EEXIST) {
00578                                         fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: mkdir %s : %s\n",
00579                                                 progname, tempdir,
00580                                                 strerror(errno));
00581                                         rc = 1;
00582                                         goto out;
00583                                 }
00584                         }
00585                         dir_num++;
00586                 }
00587 
00588                 fd = open_file(new_file(tempfile, tempdir, file_num),
00589                                O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC | O_LARGEFILE);
00590                 if (fd >= 0) {
00591                         if (fstat64(fd, &file) == 0) {
00592                                 inode_st = file.st_ino;
00593                         } else {
00594                                 fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: write stat '%s': %s",
00595                                         progname, tempfile, strerror(errno));
00596                                 close(fd);
00597                                 break;
00598                         }
00599                 } else {
00600                         break;
00601                 }
00602 
00603                 ret = write_chunks(fd, 0, file_size, chunk_buf, chunksize,
00604                                    time_st, inode_st, tempfile);
00605                 close(fd);
00606                 if (ret < 0) {
00607                         if (ret != -ENOSPC) {
00608                                 rc = 1;
00609                                 goto out;
00610                         }
00611                         curr_bytes = total_bytes;
00612                         break;
00613                 }
00614 
00615                 curr_bytes += file_size;
00616                 if (verbose > 1)
00617                         show_rate("write", tempfile, &start_time,
00618                                   total_bytes, curr_bytes);
00619 
00620                 fseek(countfile, 0, SEEK_SET);
00621                 if (fprintf(countfile, "%lu", num_files) < 1 ||
00622                     fflush(countfile) != 0) {
00623                         fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: writing %s failed :%s\n",
00624                                 progname, filecount, strerror(errno));
00625                 }
00626         }
00627 
00628         if (verbose) {
00629                 verbose++;
00630                 show_rate("write", tempfile, &start_time,
00631                           total_bytes, curr_bytes);
00632                 printf("\nwrite complete\n");
00633                 verbose--;
00634         }
00635 
00636 out:
00637         fclose(countfile);
00638 
00639         return rc;
00640 }
00641 
00642 /*
00643  * dir_read: This function reads directories and files on device.
00644  * it works for both full and partial modes.
00645  */
00646 static int dir_read(char *chunk_buf, size_t chunksize,
00647                     time_t time_st, unsigned long dir_num)
00648 {
00649         char tempfile[PATH_MAX];
00650         char tempdir[PATH_MAX];
00651         unsigned long count = 0;
00652         struct stat64 file;
00653         int file_num = 0;
00654         ino_t inode_st = 0;
00655         struct timeval start_time;
00656         unsigned long long total_bytes;
00657         unsigned long long curr_bytes = 0;
00658 
00659         /* calculate total bytes that need to be read */
00660         total_bytes = calc_total_bytes("read");
00661         if (total_bytes <= 0) {
00662                 fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: unable to calculate total bytes\n",
00663                         progname);
00664                 return 1;
00665         }
00666 
00667         if (dir_num != 0)
00668                 total_bytes -= dir_num * files_in_dir * file_size;
00669 
00670         gettimeofday(&start_time, NULL);
00671         for (count = 0; count < num_files && dir_num < num_dirs; count++) {
00672                 int fd, ret;
00673 
00674                 if (file_num == 0) {
00675                         if (dir_num == num_dirs - 1)
00676                                 break;
00677 
00678                         new_dir(tempdir, dir_num);
00679                         dir_num++;
00680                 }
00681 
00682                 fd = open_file(new_file(tempfile, tempdir, file_num),
00683                                O_RDONLY | O_LARGEFILE);
00684                 if (fd >= 0) {
00685                         if (fstat64(fd, &file) == 0) {
00686                                 inode_st = file.st_ino;
00687                         } else {
00688                                 fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: read stat '%s': %s\n",
00689                                         progname, tempfile, strerror(errno));
00690                                 close(fd);
00691                                 return 1;
00692                         }
00693                 } else {
00694                         break;
00695                 }
00696 
00697                 if (count == num_files)
00698                         file_size = file.st_size;
00699                 ret = read_chunks(fd, 0, file_size, chunk_buf, chunksize,
00700                                   time_st, inode_st, tempfile);
00701                 close(fd);
00702                 if (ret)
00703                         return 1;
00704 
00705                 curr_bytes += file_size;
00706                 if (verbose > 1)
00707                         show_rate("read", tempfile, &start_time,
00708                                   total_bytes, curr_bytes);
00709 
00710                 if (++file_num >= files_in_dir)
00711                         file_num = 0;
00712         }
00713         if (verbose > 1){
00714                 verbose++;
00715                 show_rate("read", tempfile, &start_time,
00716                           total_bytes, curr_bytes);
00717                 printf("\nread complete\n");
00718                 verbose--;
00719         }
00720         return 0;
00721 }
00722 
00723 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00724 {
00725         time_t time_st = 0;             /* Default timestamp */
00726         size_t chunksize = ONE_MB;      /* IO chunk size(defailt=1MB) */
00727         char *chunk_buf;                /* chunk buffer */
00728         int error = 0;
00729         FILE *countfile = NULL;
00730         unsigned long dir_num = 0, dir_num_orig = 0;/* starting directory */
00731         int c;
00732 
00733         progname = strrchr(argv[0], '/') ? strrchr(argv[0], '/') + 1 : argv[0];
00734         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "c:hlo:pqrs:t:vw",
00735                                       longopts, NULL)) != -1) {
00736                 switch (c) {
00737                 case 'c':
00738                         chunksize = strtoul(optarg, NULL, 0) * ONE_MB;
00739                         if (chunksize == 0) {
00740                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad chunk size '%s'\n",
00741                                         optarg, progname);
00742                                 return -1;
00743                         }
00744                         break;
00745                 case 'l':
00746                         full = 1;
00747                         break;
00748                 case 'o': /* offset */
00749                         dir_num = strtoul(optarg, NULL, 0);
00750                         break;
00751                 case 'p':
00752                         file_size = ONE_MB;
00753                         chunksize = ONE_MB;
00754                         files_in_dir = 1;
00755                         full = 0;
00756                         break;
00757                 case 'q':
00758                         verbose = 0;
00759                         break;
00760                 case 'r':
00761                         readoption = 1;
00762                         break;
00763                 case 's':
00764                         file_size = strtoul(optarg, NULL, 0) * ONE_MB;
00765                         if (file_size == 0) {
00766                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad file size '%s'\n",
00767                                         optarg, progname);
00768                                 return -1;
00769                         }
00770                         break;
00771                 case 't':
00772                         time_st = (time_t)strtoul(optarg, NULL, 0);
00773                         break;
00774                 case 'v':
00775                         verbose++;
00776                         break;
00777                 case 'w':
00778                         writeoption = 1;
00779                         break;
00780 
00781                 case 'h':
00782                 default:
00783                         usage(1);
00784                         return 0;
00785                 }
00786         }
00787         testdir = argv[optind];
00788 
00789         if (!testdir) {
00790                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: pathname not given\n", progname);
00791                 usage(1);
00792                 return -1;
00793         }
00794         if (!readoption && !writeoption) {
00795                 readoption = 1;
00796                 writeoption = 1;
00797         }
00798         if (!time_st)
00799                 (void) time(&time_st);
00800         printf("Timestamp: %lu\n", (unsigned long )time_st);
00801         isatty_flag = isatty(STDOUT_FILENO);
00802 
00803         if (!full) {
00804 #ifdef HAVE_EXT2FS_EXT2FS_H
00805                 struct mntent *tempmnt;
00806                 FILE *fp = NULL;
00807                 ext2_filsys fs;
00808 
00809                 if ((fp = setmntent("/etc/mtab", "r")) == NULL){
00810                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: fail to open /etc/mtab in read"
00811                                 "mode :%s\n", progname, strerror(errno));
00812                         goto guess;
00813                 }
00814 
00815                 /* find device name using filesystem */
00816                 while ((tempmnt = getmntent(fp)) != NULL) {
00817                         if (strcmp(tempmnt->mnt_dir, testdir) == 0)
00818                                 break;
00819                 }
00820 
00821                 if (tempmnt == NULL) {
00822                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: no device found for '%s'\n",
00823                                 progname, testdir);
00824                         endmntent(fp);
00825                         goto guess;
00826                 }
00827 
00828                 if (ext2fs_open(tempmnt->mnt_fsname, 0, 0, 0,
00829                                 unix_io_manager, &fs)) {
00830                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: unable to open ext3 fs on '%s'\n",
00831                                 progname, testdir);
00832                         endmntent(fp);
00833                         goto guess;
00834                 }
00835                 endmntent(fp);
00836 
00837                 num_dirs = (fs->super->s_blocks_count +
00838                             fs->super->s_blocks_per_group - 1) /
00839                         fs->super->s_blocks_per_group;
00840                 if (verbose)
00841                         printf("ext3 block groups: %u, fs blocks: %u "
00842                                "blocks per group: %u\n",
00843                                num_dirs, fs->super->s_blocks_count,
00844                                fs->super->s_blocks_per_group);
00845                 ext2fs_close(fs);
00846 #else
00847                 goto guess;
00848 #endif
00849                 if (0) { /* ugh */
00850                         struct statfs64 statbuf;
00851 guess:
00852                         if (statfs64(testdir, &statbuf) == 0) {
00853                                 num_dirs = (long long)statbuf.f_blocks *
00854                                         statbuf.f_bsize / (128ULL << 20);
00855                                 if (verbose)
00856                                         printf("dirs: %u, fs blocks: %llu\n",
00857                                                num_dirs,
00858                                                (long long)statbuf.f_blocks);
00859                         } else {
00860                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: unable to stat '%s': %s\n",
00861                                         progname, testdir, strerror(errno));
00862                                 if (verbose)
00863                                         printf("dirs: %u\n", num_dirs);
00864                         }
00865                 }
00866         }
00867         chunk_buf = (char *)calloc(chunksize, 1);
00868         if (chunk_buf == NULL) {
00869                 fprintf(stderr, "Memory allocation failed for chunk_buf\n");
00870                 return 4;
00871         }
00872         snprintf(filecount, sizeof(filecount), "%s/%s.filecount",
00873                  testdir, progname);
00874         if (writeoption) {
00875                 (void)mkdir(testdir, dirmode);
00876 
00877                 unlink(filecount);
00878                 if (dir_num != 0) {
00879                         num_files = dir_num * files_in_dir;
00880                         if (verbose)
00881                                 printf("\n%s: %lu files already written\n",
00882                                        progname, num_files);
00883                 }
00884                 if (dir_write(chunk_buf, chunksize, time_st, dir_num)) {
00885                         error = 3;
00886                         goto out;
00887                 }
00888                 dir_num = dir_num_orig;
00889         }
00890         if (readoption) {
00891                 if (!writeoption) {
00892                         countfile = fopen(filecount, "r");
00893                         if (countfile == NULL ||
00894                             fscanf(countfile, "%lu", &num_files) != 1 ||
00895                             num_files == 0) {
00896                                 fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: reading %s failed :%s\n",
00897                                         progname, filecount, strerror(errno));
00898                                 num_files = num_dirs * files_in_dir;
00899                         } else {
00900                                 num_files -= (dir_num * files_in_dir);
00901                         }
00902                         if (countfile)
00903                                 fclose(countfile);
00904                 }
00905                 if (dir_read(chunk_buf, chunksize, time_st, dir_num)) {
00906                         fprintf(stderr, "\n%s: Data verification failed\n",
00907                                 progname) ;
00908                         error = 2;
00909                         goto out;
00910                 }
00911         }
00912         error = error_count;
00913 out:
00914         free(chunk_buf);
00915         return error;
00916 }
